alert.note: Alert for Butte; Glenn (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 15 at 2:59AM PDT until March 16 at 12:00PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Sacramento River Below Red Bluff Diversion Dam affecting Tehama County. Sacramento River At Vina Woodson Bridge affecting Tehama County. Sacramento River At Tehama Bridge affecting Tehama County. Sacramento River Near Hamilton City affecting Glenn and Butte Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in California... Sacramento River At Ord Ferry affecting Glenn and Butte Counties. For the Upper Sacramento River...including Bend Bridge, Red Bluff Diversion Dam, Tehama Bridge, Vina Woodson Bridge, Hamilton City, Ord Ferry, Butte City, Moulton Weir, Colusa Weir, Colusa Bridge, Tisdale Weir...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sacramento River near Hamilton City. * WHEN...From this morning to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 147.2 feet, Overflow begins on the east bank of the river, from near Wilson Landing Road to Highway 32. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 AM PDT Wednesday the stage was 143.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 148.3 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 147.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 148.3 feet on 12/12/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information and stage definitions refer to the following web site: wrh.noaa.gov/sto/hydro_data.php The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1200 AM PDT.
